b'"I started my Instagram page (https://t.co/sx7ENrr87Z) to have fun and show I live a normal life, going out, enjoying the theatre, dinners, holidays just like other 17 year olds. One day I\'ll be an actor and everyone will see Down Syndrome is really no big deal!" 4/4 https://t.co/LQLPO4u7ce'

b'"I\'m Millie Anna, born 31 Aug 2004 in Windsor UK. I\'m 17 and comfortable with an extra chromosome. One of my goals is to inspire other people with Down Syndrome to follow their dreams, you can do anything you want - sometimes you just need a little extra help to achieve it." 3/4 https://t.co/jkyHu7hvAq'

b'Lee has just told me \xe2\x80\x9cHe seemed to love the role and the mission and threw himself into it, then reported back as if he had just achieved an incredible act of espionage. It delighted him.\xe2\x80\x9d 3/3'

b'During one of the commercial breaks, when the audience in the theatre can stretch their legs, I spotted the handsome Colin Powell approaching. He offered me his hand,  and gave me a note of good luck from Lee \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x9cJust being the mail man\xe2\x80\x9d he said and grinned. 2/3'

b'My friend Lee was god-daughter to the late Colin Powell. At the 1999 Oscars I was on the front row with Bill Condon and Lynn Redgrave, anxiously waiting to see if our nominations for \xe2\x80\x9cGods and Monsters\xe2\x80\x9d would be converted into wins. (Well done Bill!) 1/3'

b'4/4 When it comes to abuse by people in positions of power, the correct response is clear. The accusers must be heard and the accused given the opportunity to clear their names. If the accusations prove credible, the abuser\xe2\x80\x99s access to power should be removed.'
b'3/4  I deeply regret my careless remarks and apologise unreservedly for any distress I caused.'

b'2/4 My intention was to encourage the LGBT audience I was addressing, to be proud and open about their sexuality. In doing so, my point was clumsily expressed. I would never, ever trivialise or condone abuse of any kind.'

b'Many of you sent lovely messages that weren\xe2\x80\x99t questions. Thank you for them all. If only Freddie were on @twitter ...'
b'.@pdsufferer Saraman but watch out Vi!'
b'.@BeKaterInTheSky I wouldnt be seen dead in Freddie\xe2\x80\x99s outfits but I still wear Magneto\xe2\x80\x99s Ralph Lauren overcoat from the first X --Men.'
b'.@donzoui I think Freddie is a one off'
b'@AndyDandyMandy Unbelievably yes. I\xe2\x80\x99ve enjoyed getting better at it.'
b'.@kalyndimartin I put on a costume and let Freddie admire himself in the mirror'
b'@theAnalogTimes Things are getting better for gay people, which is why the homophobes get so upset.'
b'.@Doug_E_Fresh2 I\xe2\x80\x99d love to see him in drag - Stuart too for that matter.'
b'.@_Nam_Dam_ I love his smile and his sense of humour. I only wish I knew how to pronounce his name'
b'.@Hristowen Swanning down the staircase'
b'"@Doug_E_Fresh2: @IanMcKellen Do you stay in character on set? #ViciousPBS" as much as possible.'
b'.@besuamj why dont you write to Jeremy his agent'
b'.@PeterHStephens Absolutely not. However I\xe2\x80\x99ll suggest it to Gary Janetti who knows all'
b'.@_jennnyyyy_ I think all the characters I\xe2\x80\x99ve played have been more interesting than I am'
b'.@JK_believe That Ash has no problems being friends with an old gay geezer'
b'.@SecularScot Like all good comedians Derek knows how to feed a laugh line'
b'.@EvyPanda If the entire cast of Glee got down on their knees I might have to consider it'
b'.@lizakhodarinova This is our friend Violet'
b'.@FerdiAlessio Yes. Because \xe2\x80\x9cQueens\xe2\x80\x9d sounds judgemental.'
b'. @_WalkOn_ Bliss. Took me right back to our undergraduate acting at Cambridge 50 years ago'
b'.@christianb572 Refining the acting style. Which is why I\xe2\x80\x99m looking forward to the second series'
b'.@gaystheword Oscar Wilde, Noel Coward, Quentin Criso, Stephen Fry. Spot the connection?'
b'.@terryh47 Life is a comedy. You can\xe2\x80\x99t even play Hamlet unless you know how to get a laugh.'
b'.@erinduck It\xe2\x80\x99s the only one I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever been offered'
b'.@JaneBuzJane It\xe2\x80\x99s more dangerous. you only get one chance. I\xe2\x80\x99ve just completed 450 performances on stage in Waiting For Godot'
b'.@mollyraesly Freddie make well be a wonderful actor. My favourite scene is in Episode 3 when you will see Freddie rehearsing'
b'.@BaileyHilyard Laurence Olivier in particular for his theatre work.'
b'.@BahnPamela Ghandi and Gandy'
b'.@ReillyStoner Well I hope Gandalf gets a laugh or two. Vicious is a farce: if the audience doesn\xe2\x80\x99t laugh we\xe2\x80\x99re all wasting our time'
b'.@ljbdomino Not during the recording but rehearsals have been hilarious.'
b'.@a_shibs I have a bigger ego than Freddie and Derek loves his own dog as much as Stuart adores Balthazar'
b'.@whitequeen58 For actors, comedy is a serious business. But who could not have fun with the Vicious lovelies, who are all expert comics'
b'.@Natsgrrl all the same thing really but there is a special delight in hearing an audience laugh.'
